intro: Campelepis viminea, commonly known as the flame tree or torch tree, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bright red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. The flowers are not only ornamental but also attract pollinators such as bees and birds.
